newsitem.title: UK: Salomon sees ADRs leading Russian market.
newsitem.headline: Salomon sees ADRs leading Russian market.

text.p: Salomon Brothers expects companies with American Depositary Receipts (ADRs) to lead a rally in the Russian equity market in 1997.

"The eight Russian companies with ADR programmes appreciated on a weighted average basis by 82 percent in 1996, and all ranked among the top 25 best-performing stocks in the Russian market," Salomon said in a research report.
By the end of 1997, it expects 15 companies to have ADR programmes, increasing the market capitalisation of the ADR market to 15 percent of the total of Russia's equity market from 8.6 percent.
Salomon favours LUKoil, Mosenergo, GUM and Surgutneftegaz among eight existing issues and Rostelecom, Megionneftegaz and Purneftegaz among forthcoming issues.

The other companies with ADRs are Seversky Tube, Gazprom, Chernogorneft, Tatneft, while those planning issues include UES, Irkutskenergo, Uralsvyazinform, TsUM and Norilsk Nickel, -- David Chance London newsroom 44 171 542 5887
